question: Find out the correct match.
| | Disease | Pathogen | Main organ affected |
| (A) | Filariasis | Common round worm | Small intestine |
| (B) | Ringworm | Fungus | Skin |
| (C) | Dysentery | Protozoa | Liver |
| (D) | Typhoid | Bacteria | Lungs |
explanation: Ringworm is caused by fungi (Microsporum, Trichophyton, Epidermophyton) and affects the skin. Filariasis is caused by Wuchereria (Filarial worm), not round worm (Ascaris). Typhoid affects the intestine, not lungs.
